trans-unit.source: Customize console views for admin roles | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Customize console views for admin roles | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use this topic to help you filter the Intune admin console view to allow your admins to see only the items they need for their role.
trans-unit.target: Use this topic to help you filter the Intune admin console view to allow your admins to see only the items they need for their role.

trans-unit.source: Customize Intune console views according to admin roles
trans-unit.target: Customize Intune console views according to admin roles

trans-unit.source: You can filter the Microsoft Intune administration console view to allow your admins to see only the items they need to see for their role.
trans-unit.target: You can filter the Microsoft Intune administration console view to allow your admins to see only the items they need to see for their role.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can allow only admin console operators to update malware definitions or reset the passcode on devices.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can allow only admin console operators to update malware definitions or reset the passcode on devices.

trans-unit.source: You do this by using preset **designations** that you assign to specific users.
trans-unit.target: You do this by using preset **designations** that you assign to specific users.

trans-unit.source: When these users access the admin console, they can only see items that are specific to their designation.
trans-unit.target: When these users access the admin console, they can only see items that are specific to their designation.

trans-unit.source: To create a custom view
trans-unit.target: To create a custom view

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin** > **Service Administrators**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin** > **Service Administrators**.

trans-unit.source: From the list of service administrators, choose the user whose designation you want to change, and then choose **Manage Access**.
trans-unit.target: From the list of service administrators, choose the user whose designation you want to change, and then choose **Manage Access**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Access** dialog box, choose the level of access that you want to give the selected user.
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Access** dialog box, choose the level of access that you want to give the selected user.

trans-unit.source: You can choose from:
trans-unit.target: You can choose from:

trans-unit.source: Full access
trans-unit.target: Full access

trans-unit.source: Read-only access
trans-unit.target: Read-only access

trans-unit.source: Helpdesk - Groups node
trans-unit.target: Helpdesk - Groups node

trans-unit.source: Full access and read-only access are self-explanatory.
trans-unit.target: Full access and read-only access are self-explanatory.

trans-unit.source: **Helpdesk - Groups Node** restricts what the admin can see and do to the following:
trans-unit.target: **Helpdesk - Groups Node** restricts what the admin can see and do to the following:

trans-unit.source: See lists of users and devices.
trans-unit.target: See lists of users and devices.

trans-unit.source: The admin cannot use filters to modify the view.
trans-unit.target: The admin cannot use filters to modify the view.

trans-unit.source: However, you can use group filtering to modify what the admin can see.
trans-unit.target: However, you can use group filtering to modify what the admin can see.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune](use-groups-to-manage-users-and-devices-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune](use-groups-to-manage-users-and-devices-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Print the list of users and devices
trans-unit.target: Print the list of users and devices

trans-unit.source: Export the list of users and devices
trans-unit.target: Export the list of users and devices

trans-unit.source: View the properties of a user or device
trans-unit.target: View the properties of a user or device

trans-unit.source: Perform the following remote tasks:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following remote tasks:

trans-unit.source: Run a full malware scan
trans-unit.target: Run a full malware scan

trans-unit.source: Run a quick malware scan
trans-unit.target: Run a quick malware scan

trans-unit.source: Restart a computer
trans-unit.target: Restart a computer

trans-unit.source: Update malware definitions
trans-unit.target: Update malware definitions

trans-unit.source: Refresh policies
trans-unit.target: Refresh policies

trans-unit.source: Refresh inventory
trans-unit.target: Refresh inventory

trans-unit.source: Lock a device remotely
trans-unit.target: Lock a device remotely

trans-unit.source: Reset a passcode
trans-unit.target: Reset a passcode

trans-unit.source: When the admin that you configured next opens the Intune admin console, they will be given the level of access that you designated.
trans-unit.target: When the admin that you configured next opens the Intune admin console, they will be given the level of access that you designated.
